meanings.definition: To remove fuel from (a nuclear reactor)
meanings.sent1: The technician carefully defuels the nuclear reactor for maintenance.
meanings.sent2: It is important to defuel the reactor before conducting any repairs.
meanings.sent3: Why did the clumsy scientist defuel the reactor right before the experiment?
meanings.sent4: The process of defueling the reactor is like taking a sip from a full glass.
meanings.sent5: The loud alarm signaled the need to defuel the reactor immediately.

meanings.definition: To deplete the fuel supply of (a vehicle)
meanings.sent1: The long journey defuels the car quickly.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to refuel before the trip to avoid defueling halfway.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids tried to defuel the car by siphoning gas.
meanings.sent4: The road trip seemed to defuel the car faster than usual.
meanings.sent5: The old truck struggled as it started to defuel on the highway.

meanings.definition: To reduce the amount of fuel in (a system)
meanings.sent1: The energy-saving mode defuels the system to conserve power.
meanings.sent2: The new software update aims to defuel the system for better efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected power outage defueled the system, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The constant use of the device slowly defuels its battery over time.
meanings.sent5: The engineer's goal is to defuel the system without affecting its performance.
